snippet: The clashes, if confirmed, would represent some of the worst direct spillover fighting in Lebanon since Syria’s uprising began more than two years ago.
abstract: Syrian rebels battle fighters from Lebanese militant group Hezbollah in border region between two countries, leaving as many as 12 fighters dead; battle is latest sign that Lebanon is being pulled into Syria's lengthy civil war.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and HALA DROUBI
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Beirut, and Brian Knowlton from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The clashes, if confirmed, would represent some of the worst direct spillover fighting in Lebanon since Syria’s uprising began more than two years ago.

headline.seo: Hezbollah and Syria Rebels Clash on Border
headline.main: Hezbollah and Rebels of Syria in Border Fight
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah and Rebels Of Syria in Border Fight

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
